Alright, time to actually make a serious review of TF2, the game which basically stole hours of my life and has gotten me into trouble with my social life many, many different times. It has been widely considered a massive success, and clearly still stand the test of time on steam charts. While it has been in an ongoing update drought, I'm not talking about just the recent times. No... I'm talking about the game from the beginning until now, the game which stole everyone's hearts, minds, time, and most certainly money. From the meet the team videos, to the comics., this universe is a giant, fun area of complex feelings, ranging from those times when we got fucking destroyed by a god tier sniper and raged hard, to those times when we got together as a team to fight the enemy and destroy them. To even those times when we were in a good mood and found a player we genuinely enjoyed talking to, slowly making friends and becoming buddies. People have found so much joy in an over 10 year old game, and while the train has certainly lost speed over the years with the lack of updates and seemingly declining mental health in all players involved. The train is still moving, the flag of hope and communal value this game has started is still there. I'm proud of this community, this game, the developers still trucking, and Valve... For creating an awesome game that captured the hearts and minds of children, men, females, and everyone that has ever played this game. May this train keep rolling until it's last coal is used, it's last horn has been blown, until the lights in the train fade and it comes to a standstill, and even then. I believe it'll still keep on going, while it might not be the game, it'll be in the minds and hearts of all who played this masterpiece of a game.

Alright lad, you're looking at the game wondering if you should install it...wtf are you doing, scroll up and hit that INSTALL button, future you will thank you for it!
This game will provide you with the most fun you've ever had in ages, the community is hilarious, the mechanics are amazing, the classes are all interesting and extremely fun to play as.
Do you like stealth? we have the Spy.
Do you like Hyper-Speed? we have the Scout.
Do you not like aiming? we have the Pyro!
Do you LIKE aiming? we have the Sniper! 
Do you like explosions? well say hello to Soldier and Demoman.
Do you like to not play? Engineer is the one for you!
Do you like being a russian fat man with a minigun that kills everything on sight? HEAVY!
Do you like being a lunatic yet helpful teammate that gets love from the entire team? Medic is the one!
So come on in ladies and gentlemen, and have some fun with us!

Wanted to rewrite my review for this game i was going to wait tell i gotten 2000 again but i feel like doing this now TF2 for me has legit been in my life forever started to play this game on the orange box back in 2009 i loved this game it is a really fun fps you could  choose to  snipe someone or just  say fuck it and just a 5 people a a jar of piss get no kills an still have fun this game is fun to the game play and lore i remember when a new weapon, map, buff, or Nerf the whole map would just be everyone play it to test it from the sfm to the custom weapon there is something for you the skill ceiling is so high i had this little saying back in 2014 even if you good there at least someone better than you to push you to get better everything is this game is amazing most people  prefer to play the game for mvm for just play the game for competitive most play it Casually but ever game isn't without is hack i feel like source games have the hackers maybe idk the hacker in tf2 gotten so bad that  there are aimbot bots there was a time in tf2 where you couldn't have join  server without a mass wave of bots attacking then there was a ddos bots it got so bad value was forced to (updated) even after that it didn't even fix the problem The community at this point is wait the a real anti bot updated! the fact that's game hasn't received in over 1000 days is really sad i know there isn't a lot of people working on this game anymore but the fact that there is a mobile game of tf2 that's getting updated more is just;-; the community of this game is amazing sometimes we got mods of tf2 like tfc, lambda fortress, op, and a lot more 12 years and over 8000 hours tf2 is an awesome game at times its noob friendly for other people it's not but tf2 in my option gets a 10/10!

This game has a good art design, and is extremely fun to play when you get the hang of it. There is a steep learning curve, but had a vast amount of depth for players who are willing to put in the time. I would recommend this game to people who are new to pc gaming, or to anyone who hasn't tried it yet. It is really rewarding for anyone who sticks around.
Yes

While the game has undergone many changes over the years, some more welcome then other, the game is still at it's core incredibly fun and deep with many modes and mods for you to find your niche of gameplay you enjoy.

I got this game from my sister at my 14th birthday and is and will keep being one of the best gifts i have ever gotten and will always be a game i will point at to talk about how to make a game fun and competative without making it "unforgiving" or "hard"

you might look at my hours played and go "WOW" but really, if other games never managed to pull me away from this game i would probliby be up there with the most extreme players clocking in around 5-10k hours.

Now, for my personal negative take on one aspects of the game, the cosmetics are really out of hand to the point where i feel its impacting the core gameplay experience, not because of any balancing or similar, but because its just really easy to pick out the advanced or veteran players depending on how extremely glowy or otherwise neon colored they are, making it easy to target lesser players and stomp them.

Random Crits is the Default Setting on many servers, while this is an attempt to infuse some randomness to the game allowing particularly less skilled players to have the chance to kill players, it ultimatly might cause you to lose fights you were about to win because of a stray crit, punishing players for playing consistently rather then gung-ho.

Stay away from Microtransactions, especially the gambling part in-game, if there is anything time has showed overtime is that these kind of microtransactions are very very bad for you.
Every variety of weapon that actually changes how the weapon functions can be unlocked by completing ingame achievments tied to the classes and most of the cosmetics can be crafted or dropped by the game itself.

The wiki for the game is EXTREMELY indepth and will help even the most veteran players figure things out they can't understand, if you have any questions i would highly suggest looking there for answers.

But hey, you dont have to even pay to play the game like when it was released, its free!
so hop in and try it for yourself, just make sure you try every class to see if you click with any of them.
